com.picocontainer

Interface Injector<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentAdapter<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    StaticInjector<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFieldInjector, AbstractInjector, AnnotatedFieldInjection.AnnotatedFieldInjector, AnnotatedMethodInjection.AnnotatedMethodInjector, CompositeInjection.CompositeInjector, ConstructorInjection.ConstructorInjector, FactoryInjector, IterativeInjector, Jsr330ConstructorInjection.ConstructorInjectorWithForcedPublicCtors, MethodInjection.MethodInjector, MultiArgMemberInjector, MultiInjection.MultiInjector, NamedFieldInjection.NamedFieldInjector, NamedMethodInjection.NamedMethodInjector, ProviderAdapter, SetterInjection.SetterInjector, SpecificFieldInjector, SpecificMethodInjector, TypedFieldInjection.TypedFieldInjector

    public interface Injector<T>
extends ComponentAdapter<T>
    Implementers are responsible for instantiating and injecting dependancies into Constructors, Methods and Fields.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.picocontainer.ComponentAdapter

        ComponentAdapter.NOTHING

      • partiallyDecorateComponentInstance

        Object partiallyDecorateComponentInstance(PicoContainer container,
                                        Type into,
                                        T instance,
                                        Class<?> superclassPortion)
        Does a partial decoration. This is necessary since in composite injection, you need to inject the superclass fields/methods first before injecting the subtype fields/methods.
        Parameters:
        container -
        into -
        instance - the instance we're decorating.
        superclassPortion - the portion of the object to decorate.
        Returns:
